info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 17 at 8:40PM EDT until July 17 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALEXANDER...EASTERN FULTON...CARLISLE...HICKMAN... SOUTHERN BALLARD AND EASTERN MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES... At 739 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wickliffe to Towosahgy State Historic Site, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Cairo, Hickman, Clinton, Bardwell, Wickliffe, Towosahgy State Historic Site, Big Oak Tree State Park, Barlow, Wyatt, Cayce, Dorena, Fulgham, Lovelaceville, Arlington, Columbus and Blandville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
